title: encoding
content:
I'm about to make a new font and I'm not sure which encoding to use.  
I will have Latin characters + some custom ligatures + alternate versions + small capitals.

Should I use ISO-8859-1 with additional characters or Unicode ?

If using Unicode, all the codes seem to be dedicated to some usage. And i'm not sure where to place my custom characters. Are there some rules for that ?

For example, I put my first custom ligature at U+FB07, because the [unicode code charts](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317220738/http:/www.unicode.org/charts/PDF/UFB00.pdf) says Latin Ligatures start at U+FB00 with only 7 foreseen. Is that the way to do or am I just making to much fuss about this and should I just add some extra places at the end of the font for my own needs ?

PS: I'm using FontForge.
author: lvr123

comments.content:
Custom ligatures shouldn’t be assigned to codepoints, they belong to OpenType features:  
 [http://ilovetypography.com/OpenType/opentype-features.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317220738/http:/ilovetypography.com/OpenType/opentype-features.html "http://ilovetypography.com/OpenType/opentype-features.html")  
 [http://opentypecookbook.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317220738/http:/opentypecookbook.com/ "http://opentypecookbook.com")
Thanks! This link cleared out all my last questions.
